chapter.title: Supported Systems
chapter.subtitle: Supported UNIX-like OSes
chapter.para: OpenNMS is written almost entirely in Java, and should be able to run on any system that suuports the Java 1.4 Virtual Machine. There are requirements for other programs such as PostgreSQL, Perl, RRDTool and Tomcat4, but the 1.4 JDK is the key requirement (as most of the other packages can be compiled from source).
The following are the systems that support or are known to run OpenNMS.

sect1.title: Fully Supported
sect1.para: The following Linux distributions and other unix-like systems are supported out-of-the-box with native installation packages.
sect1.bridgehead: Red Hat Linux 7.x, Red Hat Linux 8, Red Hat Linux 9 and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 3
sect1.para: PostgreSQL 7.2 and later has shipped with Red Hat Linux since version 7.3. Be sure to follow the above instructions.

formalpara.title: Fedora Core 1, Fedora Core 2 and Fedora Core 3.
formalpara.para: OpenNMS is known to build and run on Fedora Core 1, Fedora Core 2 and Fedora Core 3.

formalpara.title: Debian Woody on Intel
formalpara.para: Debian packages should be available on ftp.opennms.org, and at the following apt-repository:deb http://debian.opennms.org/apt debian/opennms stable

sect1.para: Special Tomcat 4.1 packages were created, since only 4.0 is supported in stable. For instructions see this How-To written by Ian MacDonald.

formalpara.title: Solaris 8 and Solaris 9 on x86 and SPARC
formalpara.para: Packages are available at ftp.opennms.org for Solaris 8 and Solaris 9 running on SPARC and Solaris 9 running on x86.

formalpara.title: Mandrake 8, Mandrake 9 and Mandrake 10
formalpara.para: Please note that while we build packages for Mandrake 8.x, we do not do any formal testing on it. Packages are provided as a convenience.

formalpara.title: SuSE 8 and SuSE 9
formalpara.para: OpenNMS is known to build and run on SuSE.

formalpara.title: MacOSX 10.3
formalpara.para: On MacOSX, the Fink distribution packages of OpenNMS are supported. See the Fink web site for more information on installing and using Fink.

sect1.para: Also note that on MacOSX, PostgreSQL must be configured in the same manner as above for Linux. However, to do so you will need to update the SHM settings so that the OS allows enough resources for PostgreSQL to run with larger buffers.

To do so, you must edit /System/Library/StartupItems/SystemTuning/SystemTuning so that the sysctl lines look like so (at a minimum): sysctl -w kern.sysv.shmmax=16777216 sysctl -w kern.sysv.shmmin=1 sysctl -w kern.sysv.shmmni=128 sysctl -w kern.sysv.shmseg=32 sysctl -w kern.sysv.shmall=4096

sect1.title: Unsupported
sect1.para: The following UNIX systems are unsupported, but have been known to work.

formalpara.title: Debian Woody on SPARC
formalpara.para: OpenNMS is known to run on Debian on SPARC

formalpara.title: Solaris 7
formalpara.para: There have been reports of OpenNMS building and running on Solaris on the discuss list.
